text: I am trying to save my app settings and I get this "Something went wrong when saving your application details."
Any ideas?

hello, anyone knows if it is possible to attach HubSpot tracking code like this <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/reports/install-the-HubSpot-tracking-code> on an ajax webform? I checked all the requirements for the form listen on that page but on input submit click I only see a tracking request to hubpot but not the form submit... we are using 'non-HubSpot' forms on an old wordpress website, and trying to migrate those functionalities on a drupal website, still maintaining the contact creation though js with that tracking code

Hello HubSpot Team,

I am writing to you from across the desk at Salesforce. Hope you are all doing well.

I have a mutual customer that uses Salesforce CRM and HubSpot Marketing. They have an immediate requirement to integrate our two platforms :) I am running into a wall understanding what the Salesforce requirements are to allow for this. For e.g <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/salesforce/install-the-HubSpot-salesforce-integration> its says you need any Salesforce edition with an API enabled or Salesforce professional however Salesforce professional does not come with API access as standard. There is an ability to add on ‘web services API’ to professional but im not sure if this will allow the bi-drectional integration? Could someone help me out as I understand HubSpot manage the connector here. Thanks so much

you can put html in the cta tool. Then you can style it out in your stylesheet. you can do just abotu whatever you want with a cta.

That being said — I think the best way to use a cta is to use a button.  I say this because of how CTAs load in the page lifecycle.
If you are putting that button into a more designed out area — name it properly and only use it in that designed out area.

While I have this soapbox, I think CTAs are over utilized by most — CTAs shouldn’t be in your header — they shouldn’t be on the home page. Those are not conversion path pages. The whole concept of ctas and how they report — I only use them in blogs and would recommend for you to do that as well.

If you have some two or three page conversion path, use ctas to track that. (and I’d advise conversion goals in GA as well) as long as you have a clear path to conversion and then can follow up from a CTA to a FORM, etc…

If your form doesn’t have a <form> then i don’t think it will see it.

the tracking code wouldn’t create the contact — the form submission will. If your form isn’t recognized by the HubSpot tracking code, then it won’t sync the two — If that is the case I’d look at using a HubSpot from (why do you need to use some other form anyways, where is that form going? Whats the reason it isn’t a hs form?)

If you can’t use a HS form, and the tracking code (isn’t script erroring or you have other javascript errors on the page) doesn’t recognize your form submission, then your next best option is using the forms api to submit to HubSpot
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form>

here is an example: <https://gist.github.com/NickDeckerDevs/e0df794e1ba6ae385906ffc333002c3d>

It doesn’t have the updated
```"objectTypeId": "0-1",```
but it should be good enough to get you going
script to get the HubSpot token: <https://gist.github.com/NickDeckerDevs/12e794893ad5e431459e7e0ddfaff8b0>

My form is a form generate by drupal/webforms, it outputs a <form> with <input type="submit"> , so that should be compliant to the HubSpot rules for catching the submit, but if the form is sent via ajax HubSpot doesn't send the form, I only see a .gif tracking request to <http://hsforms.com|hsforms.com>
are your gists usable with auto generated forms (so called non-HubSpot forms) or should I generate a form on HubSpot and specify the id when sending the data with that onsubmit handler?
if you are trying to use the forms api, you’ll need to create a form that has the same inputs, and make sure you convert whatever from name/ids are to teh proper HubSpot items
it needs the portal and id to send to
mh ok that would be a bit of a pain but it could be the last resort
do you know any way to force the form submit as if the tracking code does normally? before we had a wordpress website with an ajax form submit and HubSpot worked there
I wish I had this answer for you!! I’ve never had an issue where the form wasn’t caught by HubSpot
are there like passwords or ssn or somethign as a field?
can you share the url?
sure, it is a staging area , look at the bottom of the website https://  steel. <http://apvdtest.it|apvdtest.it> / en /sustainability  (remove the spaces)
no password or other ssn fields, you should accept the cookie banner for hs script
did you see my contact show up? <mailto:nicholas@deckerdevs.com|nicholas@deckerdevs.com> ?
It looks like it should work from looking at the network tab, no console errors
nope :disappointed:
thanks for the input <@U25PYL3Q8>
I realize a lot of that is my opinion and wasn’t asked for —
if you need some help doing something cool just respond in here and i’d be glad to help
Yeah, that doesn’t make a lot of sense, I’m not sure why it isn’t working
strange, thanks anyway

I wish i had a better answer — just haven’t ran into this issue. If I had to dig into this, I’d look at building a regular html form with a normal form with an email and a first name property, a input type = submit, have it have like an action to submit it to a different page…

if that works, and sends over, then I’d look at how the drupal form is submitting, is it like preventing default on the button submit or returning false.. then try to mimic that in the html form and determine if you need to work around something.

If you are still unable to reproduce the non submission at this point —
#3, #4 look to be the issues that MIGHT be goign on
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Non-HubSpot-forms-are-not-captured-when-they-are-submitted-via/m-p/410268>
i'm inspecting now how drupal attaches ajax events in core/misc/ajax.js maybe the answer is some stopPropagation or similar/... :confused:
but I don't see any hs event handler on the for or submit button anyway....
data-hs-cf-bound="true" is there though
ok found!, line 323
thank you <@U25PYL3Q8> for all the hints
nice!
Has anyone integrated HubSpot using the API access who could share their experience? Thanks
